intro: Peucedanum carvifolium var. heterophyllum, commonly known as the variable cow parsley, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is native to parts of Europe and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland margins or along stream banks. It produces small, elongated fruits called schizocarps, which disperse by wind. The plant is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
